intro: Chrysosplenium flagelliferum, commonly known as the flagellate chrysosplenium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its creeping growth habit and dense, mat-forming foliage. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, typically arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are often hairy and have a distinctive, lance-shaped appearance. Chrysosplenium flagelliferum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested habitats.
